Package civitas.celestis.graphics

Class SimpleColor

java.lang.Object
civitas.celestis.graphics.SimpleColor
All Implemented Interfaces:
Color8, Packable32, Packable64, Serializable
public class SimpleColor extends Object implements Color8
An 8-bit color with no extra precision.
See Also:
  • Color8
  • LinearColor
  • Serialized Form

    • SimpleColor

      public SimpleColor(int r, int g, int b)
      Create a new color by assigning the RGB components separately. All components should be within the range of 0-255. The alpha component is assigned to 255. (opaque)
      Parameters:
      r - The red component of this color
      g - The green component of this color
      b - The blue component of this color

    • SimpleColor

      public SimpleColor(int r, int g, int b, int a)
      Create a new color by assigning the RGBA components separately. All components should be within the range of 0-255.
      Parameters:
      r - The red component of this color
      g - The green component of this color
      b - The blue component of this color
      a - The alpha component of this color

    • pack24

      public int pack24()
      Packs this color into 24 bits. The alpha component is lost. The return value of this method should be in the following format.

      Bits 16-23 represent the red component of this color as an unsigned byte.
      Bits 8-15 represent the green component of this color as an unsigned byte.
      Bits 0-7 represent the blue component of this color as an unsigned byte.

      Specified by:
      pack24 in interface Color8
      Returns:
      The 24 bit representation of this color
      See Also:
      • Color8.pack24(int, int, int)

    • pack32

      public int pack32()
      Packs this color into 32 bits. The return value of this method should be in the following format.

      Bits 24-31 represent the alpha component of this color as an unsigned byte.
      Bits 16-23 represent the red component of this color as an unsigned byte.
      Bits 8-15 represent the green component of this color as an unsigned byte.
      Bits 0-7 represent the blue component of this color as an unsigned byte.

      This is the same format that the AWT Color class uses.

      Since SimpleColor is already packaged in 32 bits, this is simply a getter method with no conversion involved.

      Specified by:
      pack32 in interface Color8
      Specified by:
      pack32 in interface Packable32
      Returns:
      The 32 bit representation of this color
      See Also:
      • Color8.pack32(int, int, int, int)

    • pack64

      public long pack64()
      Packs this color into 64 bits. The return value of this method should be in the following format.

      Bits 48-65 represent the red component of this color.
      Bits 32-47 represent the green component of this color.
      Bits 16-31 represent the blue component of this color.
      Bits 0-15 represent the alpha component of this color.

      Specified by:
      pack64 in interface Color8
      Specified by:
      pack64 in interface Packable64
      Returns:
      The 64 bit representation of this color
      See Also:
      • Color8.pack64(float, float, float, float)

    • awt32

      @Nonnull public Color awt32()
      Converts this color into an AWT Color. This packs the color into 32 bits, preserving the alpha component.
      Specified by:
      awt32 in interface Color8
      Returns:
      The AWT representation of this color

    • awt24

      @Nonnull public Color awt24()
      Converts this color into an AWT Color. This packs the color into 24 bits, dropping the alpha component. The alpha value will be 255. (opaque)
      Specified by:
      awt24 in interface Color8
      Returns:
      The AWT representation of this color

    • equals

      public boolean equals(Object obj)
      Checks for equality between this color and the provided object obj. This compares the 32-bit RGBA representation of the colors, and any precision beyond the representable range will be ignored.
      Specified by:
      equals in interface Color8
      Overrides:
      equals in class Object
      Parameters:
      obj - The object to compare to
      Returns:
      true if the object is also a color, and the two colors represent the same color (the 32-bit RGBA representation is equal)

    • parseColor

      Deserializes a string into a SimpleColor.
      Parameters:
      input - The input string to parse
      Returns:
      The parsed color
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - When the format is invalid
